name: Temple of Bel
description: The Temple of Bel in Palmyra, Syria
long_description: The Temple of Bel (Arabic: معبد بل‎) is an ancient stone ruin located in Palmyra, Syria. The temple, consecrated to the Semitic god Bel, worshipped at Palmyra in triad with the lunar god Aglibol and the sun god Yarhibol, formed the center of religious life in Palmyra and was dedicated in 32 AD. Aedeen Cremin considers its ruins the best preserved at Palmyra.
